thread.title: KTM to launch new 250 Duke in India on February 23? : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
thread.title_full: KTM to launch new 250 Duke in India on February 23? : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today

title: KTM to launch new 250 Duke in India on February 23? : Upcoming Launches, News - India Today
text:
KTM to launch new 250 Duke in India on February 23? IndiaToday.in | New Delhi, February 21, 2017 | Written by Pratik Rakshit | UPDATED 13:06 IST 
According to reports, KTM has a surprise in store along with the launch of the all new 2017 390 Duke and 2017 200 Duke on February 23. Now reports suggest, that the company might also launch the 2017 250 Duke in India, with spy shots recently surfaced on the internet. 
Now, there are also reports that say that KTM might just launch the new 250 Duke instead of the 200 Duke. We had earlier reported that KTM has discontinued the production of the 200 Duke to make way for the 250 Duke. 
Design: 
The new 250 Duke will be based on the design philosophy of the 2017 390 Duke, but might miss out on some premium features. These include LED headlamps and ride by wire system. However, the new 250 Duke will get ABS as standard and new LCD instrumentation console. 
Engine: 
According to reports, the new 250 Duke will come with a 248.8cc single cylinder liquid cooled engine that produces maximum power output of 31 hp and maximum torque of 24NM, mated to a six-speed transmission and will comply with BS-IV emission norms. 2017 KTM 250 Duke 
Features: 
Now, not much is known of the India-spec Duke 250, but from the spy shots, the new 250 Duke will come with new MRF Revz-FC1 and Revz-C1 tyres, and the instrument cluster from the outgoing 200 Duke. 
Competition: 
The new KTM 250 Duke will go up against the newly launched Yamaha FZ-25 in India. 
Price: 
We expect the new 250 Duke to come for a price of Rs 1.7 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi) - Rs 1.9 lakh (ex showroom, New Delhi). It will be placed between the 200 Duke and 390 Duke in India.
